channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: Heidi Klum reveals her much-anticipated 2025 Halloween costume
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Heidi Klum donned green scales and squirming snakes to transform herself into Medusa for Halloween on Friday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Military strikes on Venezuela appear increasingly likely
item.description: The U.S. launching strikes within Venezuela is looking increasingly likely as the Trump administration continues to bolster the buildup of military assets in the region, turning up the pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, whom U.S.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Air traffic controller shortages lead to broader US flight delays as shutdown nears one-month mark
item.description: Travel delays were adding up at airports across the U.S. on Friday as the government shutdown drags on, putting even more pressure on air traffic controllers who have been working without pay for a month. U.S.
item.dc:creator: RIO YAMAT, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Biden immigration policies under fire after illegal immigrant with prior DUIs charged in 14-year-old's death
item.description: An Illegal immigrant with two prior DUI arrests is accused of killing a 14-year-old California student in a hit-and-run crash, highlighting failures in immigration enforcement.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Multiple people have been arrested in Michigan in a Halloween weekend attack plot, FBI director says
item.description: DEARBORN, Mich. (AP) — Multiple people who had been allegedly plotting a violent attack over the Halloween weekend were arrested Friday in Michigan, FBI Director Kash Patel said in a social media post. The law enforcement effort was focused on suburban Detroit.
item.dc:creator: MIKE HOUSEHOLDER and ERIC TUCKER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Republican leaders reject Trump's demands to scrap the Senate filibuster to end the shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Back from a week abroad, President Donald Trump threw himself into the shutdown debate, calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster and reopen the government, an idea swiftly rejected Friday by Republican leaders who have long opposed such a move.
item.dc:creator: LISA MASCARO and MARY CLARE JALONICK, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs transferred to New Jersey prison to serve 4-year prostitution-related sentence
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Sean “Diddy” Combs has been transferred to a prison in New Jersey to serve out the remainder of his four-year prison sentence on prostitution-related charges.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: ICE officer shoots illegal immigrant during Phoenix traffic stop gone wrong, both hospitalized
item.description: ICE officer and Honduran man injured in Phoenix shooting during traffic stop. Jose Garcia-Sorto hospitalized in stable condition after Interstate 17 incident.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Missing 13-year-old Louisana girl found in Pittsburgh basement
item.description: During questioning, investigators learned he had been with the girl at the Greyhound Bus Station in Baton Rouge earlier that week.
item.dc:creator: Trinity Velazquez, NewsNation

item.title: Giuffre family welcomes Andrew's fall from royal status but wants more action
item.description: LONDON (AP) — British politicians, the public and the family of Virginia Roberts Giuffre on Friday praised King Charles III’s decision to strip his brother Andrew of his princely title and spacious home, a banishment that has left the disgraced royal increasingly exposed to political and legal scrut
item.dc:creator: JILL LAWLESS and BRIAN MELLEY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Trump urged GOP-led states to redraw US House districts. Now other states also are gerrymandering
item.description: President Donald Trump's call for Republicans to redraw U.S. House districts ahead of next year's election has triggered an unusual outbreak of mid-decade gerrymandering among both Republican- and Democratic-led states.
item.dc:creator: DAVID A. LIEB, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Murder charges filed after 5-year-old's suspicious disappearance from his own neighborhood in Idaho
item.description: Idaho prosecutors file murder charges four years after 5-year-old Michael Vaughan vanished from Fruitland neighborhood in 2021 disappearance case.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Wisconsin becomes the 36th state to limit cellphones in schools
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — Wisconsin became the 36th state to limit cellphones and other electronic devices in school Friday, when its Democratic governor signed a bill requiring districts to prohibit phone use during class time.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT BAUER, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Ohio panel and Virginia lawmakers move forward with congressional redistricting plans
item.description: An Ohio panel adopted new U.S. House districts on Friday that could boost the GOP’s chances of winning two additional seats in next year’s elections and aid President Donald Trump’s efforts to hold on to a slim congressional majority.
item.dc:creator: DAVID A. LIEB, OLIVIA DIAZ and MARK SCOLFORO, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Trump says he’s not considering strikes within Venezuela
item.description: President Trump on Friday said he was not considering strikes within Venezuela following reports his administration had identified potential military targets within the country.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, NewsNation

item.title: South Carolina man chooses execution by firing squad despite concerns over last death by bullets
item.description: COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) — A man on death row in South Carolina who taunted investigators with messages written with a victim's blood chose Friday to die by firing squad. Stephen Bryant, 44, will be the third man this year to die by South Carolina's newest execution method. His execution is set for Nov.
item.dc:creator: JEFFREY COLLINS, Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Alabama man charged with threatening rabbis, imam and others in multiple Southern states
item.description: MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) — Federal prosecutors have charged an Alabama man with making threatening calls and texts to multiple rabbis, an imam and others in the South, including telling one rabbi that “I want you to die.
item.dc:creator: KIM CHANDLER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Ohio OKs new map giving GOP an edge in 2 districts
item.description: The map was created without public input in a unanimous vote from the Ohio Redistricting Commission and will remain in place until 2030.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, NewsNation

item.title: Halloween threat puts kids in danger as drug-laced sweets spook parents, trick-or-treaters: expert
item.description: Police warn parents about drug-laced Halloween candy as THC and fentanyl treats disguised as popular brands threaten trick-or-treaters nationwide this year.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Controversy over Tucker Carlson interview reveals conservative movement's conflict over antisemitism
item.description: The president of a Republican-aligned think tank has defended Tucker Carlson after the conservative media personality offered a platform to a far-right activist known for pushing white nationalist and antisemitic views.
item.dc:creator: Matt Brown, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: 2 die in flooded New York City basements during heavy rainstorm
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Two people died in flooded New York City basements Thursday during a rainstorm that shut down roadways and caused airport delays, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Extreme hurricanes have nearly doubled due to warming waters
item.description: Hurricane Melissa was one of the strongest hurricanes on record in the Atlantic. So is that proof that climate change is amplifying hurricanes? The short answer is no. Evidence of climate change requires a much longer record.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Berardelli, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Vance predicts holiday air travel will be 'a disaster' if shutdown does not end
item.description: Vice President Vance predicted Thursday that holiday air travel will be a “disaster” if the government shutdown does not end. “It could be a disaster,” Vance told reporters following a roundtable at the White House on how the shutdown is impacting airline travel.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, NewsNation

item.title: Pair get prison for assaulting restaurant host over where they were seated
item.description: The teenager who was attacked said the trouble began after he finally got them all seated at the one large table.
item.dc:creator: Sarai Bennett, NewsNation

item.title: RFK Jr. says no 'sufficient' evidence Tylenol definitively causes autism
item.description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said there is not “sufficient” evidence that Tylenol causes autism, softening warnings he and President Trump have repeatedly made to discourage the medicine's use by pregnant women and young children.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Weixel, WFLA, NBC

item.title: CBP seizes 166 exotic pets, including pythons and tarantulas, from car traveling to Mexico
item.description: A total of 166 reptiles and arthropods were identified within the vehicle, including dozens of pythons, numerous lizards, multiple frogs and several tarantulas.
item.dc:creator: Mia Morales, Fox 5

item.title: Teacher who was shot by 6-year-old student at school testifies she thought she had died
item.description: A former Virginia teacher who was shot by a 6-year-old student in her classroom in 2023 testified Thursday that she thought she had died that day.
item.dc:creator: JOHN RABY, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Cruise passenger, 80, found dead on island after ship's crew leaves without her
item.description: The passenger’s daughter Katherine Rees on Thursday accused the cruise company Coral Expeditions of a “failure of care and common sense” that left her mother Suzanne Rees to die alone.
item.dc:creator: Rod McGuirk, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Judge considers demand to force government to keep funding SNAP food aid despite shutdown
item.description: A federal judge in Boston on Thursday challenged the Trump administration's argument that SNAP benefits could be suspended for the first time in the food aid program's history because of the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: SNAP scams incoming, expert warns. Here's what to watch out for
item.description: The fast-approaching SNAP benefit freeze could leave millions of Americans vulnerable to scammers, officials and experts are warning.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, KRON4

item.title: Why you won't receive a Supplemental Security check on Nov. 1
item.description: October is nearly over, which means you may be checking your calendar to see when you'll receive your November Social Security benefits.
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, KRON4

item.title: Senate hearing for Trump's surgeon general pick is postponed after she goes into labor
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — A Senate hearing for President Donald Trump's surgeon general pick, Dr. Casey Means, has been postponed because she went into labor, a spokesperson for the Senate health committee said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: ALI SWENSON, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Hurricane Melissa expected to approach Bermuda today: NHC
item.description: TAMPA, Fla. (WFLA)— A Hurricane Warning is in effect for Bermuda as Hurricane Melissa is expected to approach the island later today and into tonight, the National Hurricane Center said.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Suter, WFLA, NBC
